channel.title: 3News
channel.description: 3news.co.nz - a continuously updated news site with Video on Demand, Audio on Demand, a live stream of 3 News @ 6pm, local weather, TV listings & programme information, competitions, gig guide and more more more.

item.title: Cottrell murder accused initially treated as witness
item.description: One of two men charged with murdering Wellington journalist Phillip Cottrell was initially treated as a witness, a jury has heard.

item.title: Outburst from John Key over Pike River re-entry
item.description: The Prime Minister has hit out at Labour MPs grilling him about the Pike River families' campaign to re-enter the sealed mine.

item.title: Armed man on run in Waihi
item.description: A major police operation is underway in Waihi where an armed and dangerous man is believed to have taken two children hostage.

item.title: Peters should prove case against MP - Key
item.description: Winston Peters should prove his case against Brendan Horan if he believes the MP should resign from Parliament, John Key says.

item.title: Rotorua YouTube sensation fails to attend own appeal
item.description: A Rotorua woman who became a YouTube sensation after being filmed wrestling with supermarket staff failed to appear at her court email

item.title: Mark Longley: Emily ‘can’t rest in peace’
item.description: Emily Longley's father says he is devastated the man convicted of killing her has won the right to appeal.

item.title: Fire breaks out near Chch airport
item.description: A scrub fire broke out near Christchurch International Airport this afternoon, alarming some travellers.

item.title: Mother and child missing for a month
item.description: Police have yet to find a mother and child missing from west Auckland for more than a month.

item.title: Corrections fax blunder not the first
item.description: Corrections has accidentally faxed information to wrong recipients three times this year, a select committee has been told.

item.title: Five charged after exploitation inquiry
item.description: Five people have been arrested as part of an investigation into alleged migrant labour exploitation.

item.title: Not guilty verdict for Switched on Gardener managers
item.description: A group of Switched on Gardener managers have been found not guilty of belonging to an organised criminal group.

item.title: Second man admits dairy company fraud
item.description: A second man has admitted trying to defraud Sutton Group dairy company, after a co-worker pleaded guilty to 11 charges.

item.title: Two dead in SH6 crash near Marlborough
item.description: Two people have died in a serious crash on State Highway 6 at Marlborough’s Pelorus Bridge.

item.title: Wairoa-Gisborne road partially reopens
item.description: The main route between Wairoa and Gisborne reopens to light vehicles after a stock truck crashed.

item.title: Witness says accused threatened him before attack on journo
item.description: A Dominion Post worker has told the jury in the Phillip Cottrell murder trial how one of the accused yelled expletives at him shortly before the alleged attack.

item.title: One dead after car crashes into house
item.description: A man in his 60s is dead after his car hit a house north of Christchurch.

item.title: Bodybuilder bailed on DIY drug charges
item.description: A champion bodybuilder has been remanded on bail after appearing in court on nearly 300 charges relating to performance drugs.

item.title: Fonterra plans new plant at Pahiatua
item.description: Fonterra is seeking consents to build a new milk powder plant at Pahiatua.

item.title: Maka fined heavily for under-paying worker
item.description: Former New Zealand-based rugby player Finau Maka has been heavily fined for under-paying an immigrant worker.

item.title: Lunchtime news wrap: Wednesday December 5, 2012
item.description: Embattled MP Brendan Horan is back at work, Dotcom sells his luxury cars and a photographer is under fire for failing to save a man stuck on subway tracks in New York.

item.title: Kiwi soldier injured in Afghanistan
item.description: A New Zealand soldier is recovering in hospital after being injured during live firing practice in Afghanistan.

item.title: Hobbit bodyguard failed criminal check
item.description: The bodyguard who escorted Sir Peter on the red carpet at the Hobbit premiere had failed a criminal history check.

item.title: Building activity up nearly 10 percent
item.description: The volume of building activity recorded its biggest gain in 10 years in the third quarter.

item.title: Dotcom's luxury cars up for sale
item.description: Internet mogul Kim Dotcom has sold a number of his luxury cars amid ongoing legal battles.

item.title: One dead after SH1 vehicle fire
item.description: A person has been found dead inside a burning vehicle on State Highway 1 north of Taupo.

item.title: Sex offender pleads guilty to parole breach
item.description: An elderly convicted rapist has this morning pleaded guilty to taking intimate photos of a four-year-old girl while on parole.

item.title: Passenger charged over drink-driving death
item.description: Police have vowed to take a hard line on drink driving, after charging a passenger over a deadly alcohol-related crash.

item.title: Fire official apologises over CTV rescue
item.description: A senior fire service official has made a full apology to the families of eight people who died in Christchurch CTV building.

item.title: South Auckland woman still missing
item.description: Police are still looking for a south Auckland woman who was last seen a week ago.
